page.title: 01Hyde Parish
page.content: The block includes most of Hyde Civil Parish, formed in 1979, consisting of eight widely scattered hamlets lying mainly on high ground on the north west boundary of the New Forest, dropping to farmland in the Avon valley to the west and sloping away to a wide vista of open heathland to the east. The centre of parish life is at Hyde with its church built in 1954, chapel, the primary school, the cricket club and the village hall.The population of about 1000 people comprises some New Forest families of longstanding, forests commoners and those working on traditional small holdings and in recent years others who have retired into the area or younger people who work in neighbouring towns. Originally the houses were of cob and thatch or brick and tile, more modern houses
